title: EastEnders spoilers: Priya Davdra teases Iqra and Ash drama
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Iqra Ahmed (Priya Davdra) has had a tough couple of months in EastEnders, having recently come out to her grandparents by introducing them to her girlfriend Ash. Unfortunately, though, there’s more drama on the way for the character as actress Priya Davdra gave us a sneaky insight into what’s around the corner for her on Albert Square.

Speaking exclusively to Metro.co.uk on the red carpet at the Inside Soap Awards, Priya said: ‘So obviously I’ve moved out and there’s a lot going on with that and my girlfriend is on the scene now, so there’s going to be a bit of drama there.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Revealing whether Iqra and Ash will still be together by Christmas, she said: ‘I would like to be kissing under the mistletoe but it is EastEnders so you never know.’

It looks like there’s going to be a lot going on for Iqra too over the next few weeks, with Priya also promising: ‘There’s loads of layers to Iqra. There’s stuff coming up but you’ll have to wait and see.’

We’ve got our fingers crossed that Iqra and Ash will be Walford’s power couple going into 2020.

Iqra and Ash have drama ahead (Picture: BBC)

Iqra first arrived in Albert Square back in February alongside her sister Habiba (Rukku Nahar).

Before moving onto the scene, Iqra was preparing to wed a man through an arranged marriage, however it was later revealed that she’s gay, making her the first Muslim lesbian in the soap’s history.

Speaking of Iqra’s trailblazing LGBTQ+ storyline, Priya said: ‘It was amazing. I think EastEnders has done amazing bringing this storyline out. I’m so proud to be presenting this storyline.’

description: EastEnders spoilers: Priya Davdra teases Iqra and Ash drama
